election_record.label: Virginia 1797 House of Delegates, Fairfax County

sub_unit.name: Fairfax
sub_unit.note: "The following is a state of the poll, as it stood yesterday, for the election of the representatives of Fairfax County in the State Legislature... At the instance of Mr. Hunter, we understand that the poll will be kept open during this day, agreeable to a provisionary clause in the election law, in cases of unfavorable weather." The Columbian Mirror and Alexandria Gazette (Alexandria, VA). April 18, 1797.

"Yesterday morning a poll was opened for the election of two persons to represent this county in the House of Delegates of this Commonwealth ~ In the evening it was adjourned till this morning. At that time the state of the Poll was as follows:" Alexandria Advertiser and Commercial Intelligencer (Alexandria, VA). April 18, 1797.

"On counting the votes, at the close of the poll last night, it appeared that Roger West and A. Smith, Esquires, were duly elected representatives of the county of Fairfax, in the House of Delegates, for the ensuing year." Alexandria Advertiser and Commercial Intelligencer (Alexandria, VA). April 19, 1797.

election_record.reference: Alexandria Advertiser and Commercial Intelligencer (Alexandria, VA). April 18, 1797.
